body_content.explanation: something that you have to do because it is part of your job, or something that you feel is the right thing to do:
examples: The duty of the agency is to act in the best interests of the child.
I felt it was my duty to tell them the truth.
You have a duty to yourself to take a break once in a while.
He only went to see her out of duty (= because he thought he should).
You should report for duty (= arrive at work) at 8 a.m. on Monday.
What time are you off/on duty (= when do you finish/start work) tomorrow?

body_content.explanation: to have to do something because it is your duty:
examples: We are duty bound to justify how we spend our funds.

body_content.explanation: a tax paid to the government, especially on things that you bring into a country:
examples: There's a high duty on alcohol.
